text:
Papyrus Oxyrhynchus 5101, (designated as P.Oxy.LXXVII 5101, [https://www.trismegistos.org/ldab/text.php?tm=140272 LDAB 140272] or Rahlfs 2227) is a papyrus roll which now only survives as small pieces. It is written in Koine Greek of the Septuagint (LXX). It has been palaeographycally dated to have been written between 50 and 150 C.E.
The manuscript contains the tetragrammaton to represent the Divine Name of God (Yahweh) written in palaeo-Hebrew script.
